titles: Glad tydings from heauen: or Christs glorious inuitation to all sinners, wherein is described the misery of his manhood, and the bitternesse of his passion endured for man: with sundry reasons inferred, to moue worldlings to repentance. To the tune of the Dolefull shephard, or Sandy soyle.
notes: Verse: "Awake from sinne, vaine man awake ..."
In two parts, separated for mounting; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
